website_summaries.verdict: With a stack height, ride, and responsiveness that are all created similarly with other shoes from Topo Athletic, the Hydroventure aims to be a mid-cushioning running shoe that provides ample underfoot protection while introducing an all-new feature: waterproofing. As a shoe claiming to have waterproof characteristics, the Hydroventure delivers well while accomplishing more.
pros: Some users were happy with the wide toe box that accommodated the forefoot comfortably
The incredible traction enabled a running experience that’s mostly free of any slipping, wrote one user
One reviewer said the Topo Athletic Hydroventure was unbelievably lightweight
Another user mentioned the shoe kept his foot warm and dry throughout the run and under any condition
The shoe presented underfoot steadiness and firmness on rough ground, one runner noted
Many users liked that the shoe was comfortable
A majority of runners felt that the shoe did well in keeping the foot dry while running under wet conditions
cons: The outsole did a poor job of dealing with the muddy terrain as the shoe kept slipping while running, said one reviewer
There were a few reports stating that the Hydroventure was not as responsive as other trail-running shoes from Topo Athletic

customer_reviews.title: Probably a great shoe for the right feet
customer_reviews.text: Despite the relatively wide toe box, this shoe is very low volume in the forefoot. I normally wear either a men's 10 or 10.5 EE running shoe, and for me a men's 11 in this shoe felt like I was stuffing my toes into a much smaller shoe. Design and materials seem like just what I'm looking for in a trail running/hiking shoe, but going up to a size 12 in hopes of more toe room didn't seem worth trying as the issue isn't length, nor width, but rather a lack of "head room" for the toes.
customer_reviews.author: Rangifer Rich

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Balance in Breathability, Water Shedding, Performance
customer_reviews.text: Love these, as I do all my Topo Athletic shoes. Ordered 1/2 size up as recommended by Topo and they fit perfectly. Water resistant, not water proof--these strike a great balance between breathability and shedding water in rain and wet environments. Going through stream crossings and immersing them, they will squeeze the water out pretty quickly and do not pool water in the shoe for long. I bought these because running in my MaxFly and Terraventures in pouring rains was trashing the shoes--these hold up very well in wet conditions. Mid-cushion, less than the Terraventures, but quite adequate and comfortable out to half-Marathon distances. That's as far as I've run in them so far. Good traction.
customer_reviews.author: Reformed Review

customer_reviews.title: These shoes feel great and the shipping was way faster than expected
customer_reviews.text: These shoes feel great and the shipping was way faster than expected. I was a fan of Brooks Addiction Walking Shoes only to discover from research I needed a shoe with a wider toe box to slow down this bunion on my right foot. I purchased Merrells Glove 3 and took some getting used to the zero drop with no cushion. The Topo is perfect for me. Wide toe box, narrow ankle with cushion. I'm rolling with this brand from now on.
customer_reviews.author: 3-in-1

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made garbage. Liner came separated.
customer_reviews.text: 1. Cheaply made. Liner is glue in and came separated near the heel in the right shoe (see pic) 2. Hideous in person 3. Adding to the ugliness is a chrome Event tag riveted in like old school Hiking boots. 4. Merrell, Archteryx,Altra not this cheaply made crap.
customer_reviews.author: jessy

customer_reviews.title: Been wearing keen shoes for work last 4 years. ...
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing keen shoes for work last 4 years. Never had any problems with my feet. Wanted something different so I bought these shoes. After wearing these for last 2 months my feet are killing me. Now Im experincing what may be plantar fasciitis. Going back to keens. These shoes are not for me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoe on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoe on the market, fits snug in the heal and mid foot and plenty of room for your toes to spread while running. Topo will be the only brand I'll ever purchase
customer_reviews.author: Baldylox81

customer_reviews.title: Returned item
customer_reviews.text: 9 1/2 was to small 10 was $35 more. Well built would have gotten larger size except for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Traction is good but not very aggressive
customer_reviews.text: Topo shoes are light, waterproof, and comfy. Traction is good but not very aggressive. The tread is small and close together, this is fine for running or light hiking. I use them as approach shoes in the cascade mountains, love em.
customer_reviews.author: lovesamazon

customer_reviews.title: Toebox
customer_reviews.text: As expected, though not very cushioned. Nice roomy toe box.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Boughter

customer_reviews.title: Best water proof shoe I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Best water proof shoe I've ever had. These shoes are also very comfortable and have a wide sole. Nothing else I've tried compares.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing shoes. Totally waterproof. Great fit and not too hot in 80 degree weather. Very glad I got these. Keep up the good work. The half size up recommendation is correct. I usually wear a 10 and needed an 10.5.
customer_reviews.author: Tromba 1

customer_reviews.title: a 13 is like an 11
customer_reviews.text: too small, a 13 is like an 11, is not soft inside, it is very hard
customer_reviews.author: yoel

customer_reviews.title: The design  is fine!!
customer_reviews.text: Very confortable!!! The only problem was that runs a little big but is ok!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda Calderin

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: I bought the shoes because they were recommended by my podiatrist to help with a big toe problem. The toe box is wide enough to give toes wiggle room.😊 Also the shoes arrived in two days and the company is checking to make sure I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grips any surface wet or dry.
customer_reviews.text: Best out of the box pair of shoes ever. Seriously this is my second pair and I love the so much. Great job TOPO
customer_reviews.author: Phillip80

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Right fit for daily activity and also Excellent wknd hiking~!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit small
customer_reviews.text: Bought a size 10, am returning for a size 11.
customer_reviews.author: uppu

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful shoose
customer_reviews.text: I will use it for sport exercises and outher things
customer_reviews.author: Abdulkareem

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great waterproof runner - fit is great for a wider foot!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight trail running or hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, water resistant and a roomy toe box. A great shoe for hiking or trail running, especially if you are a forefoot runner
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one size larger than I normally wear knowing that I would be using orthotics in the shoe. I am really glad I did. The shoe fits but was still a little tight. The wide toe box in this shoe did make the difference in keeping the shoe. The more I wear the shoes they seem to be more comfortable and are a pleasure to walk in.
customer_reviews.author: Ken C.

customer_reviews.title: Good comfortable cross purpose running shoe. Sole wears a little fast though.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable hybrid shoe. Enough cushion for pounding the pavement. Stable enough to for hitting technical trails. The upper breaths well despite having the water proofing along the bottom. Toe box is open enough to deal with foot expansion on longer runs. My only complaint is that the sole has worn much faster than I would like. I've owned them for about 3 months and have put an average of 35 miles per week and already worn through the rubber and a fair amount of the foam in places on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D Wilson

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT waterproof
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are supposed to be waterproof, they are not. I wanted to use these for winter running in the snow. My feet immediately get soaking wet and frozen. If you want waterproof trail running shoes, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: trailrunners

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality shoes, durable, very light, fit well, true to size (12), still waterproof, had for about two years.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Topo Hydroventure
customer_reviews.text: Wider toe box, good arch support, the sole is stiffer than a standard shoe, but not overly firm, this is my new favorite
customer_reviews.author: Julie Quillin

product_meta.title: Topo Athletic Hydroventure Men / Navy/Black (8)
product_meta.description:
The mens Topo Hydroventure is the lightest waterproof trail shoe on the market today. A single-layer eVent waterproof membrane combines with a breathable upper mesh and lining for a lightweight, supple feel not often found in waterproof shoes. The EVA midsole and full-length flexible rock plate protect against stone bruising, while delivering a smooth, responsive ride. A full-length lug rubber outsole combines multi-directional traction with mud/snow release design features.

Best For: Trail RunningStack Height: 23mm (heel) // 20mm (forefoot)
Heel to Toe Drop: 3mm
Weight: 230g (Size 7)

Cushion:

Less

More


Support:

Neutral

Stability


Pliability:

Flexible

Stiff
